@graph.name: Movin'ON GPS Telematics Integration - Connected Vehicle Platform - Route4Me Platform
@graph.description: Movin'On GPS is a company that offers several different solutions for businesses across the country. Movin'ON's fleet management platform helps you keep your employees safe and reduce costs by utilizing real-time GPS and automatic distracted driving detection. Movin'ON GPS also offers in-cab audio coaching, on-demand video retrieval, free WiFi, zero configuration, integrated GPS tracking and quick ROI. Make sure to use Route4Me Route Planner along with your telematics provider for the best results in planning, optimizing, and monitoring the routes your drivers are completing. The free WiFi access is provided throughout the country. This enables you to automatically connect without having to do any configuration beforehand. You no longer have to manually retrieve data from inside a vehicle. Connecting wirelessly saves time as well as money because there are no monthly subscriptions that come with this service. Instead there is just one installation fee upfront which makes it an easy ROI If you are looking for a great GPS solution for your fleet then look no further than Movin'ON GPS. You can even monitor new drivers with the on-demand video retrieval service. This gives you access to all videos related to their route without having to manually retrieve them from inside the vehicle first. This saves both time and money. It also provides more accurate data about driver behavior over long periods of time to give you peace of mind knowing they are always being watched! It's never been easier to keep your fleet safe with this innovative GPS solution. Movin'ON will monitor routes, watch for distracted driving, and record video of incidents all while doing it wirelessly! Finally one other thing to consider when purchasing a GPS Solution is the ROI. Movin'ON GPS offers a quick and easy return on investment with reduced costs, increased safety, decreased risk of liability for accidents as well as lower insurance premiums! If you are looking to stay ahead in today's demanding business environment then Movin'On is a great choice.
@graph.keywords: Movin'ON GPS integration, fleet telematics, connected vehicle platform, GPS tracking, driver monitoring, route optimization, fleet management, commercial fleet solutions, Route4Me platform, vendor-agnostic telematics

isPartOf.name: Route4Me Route Optimization Platform
isPartOf.description: Route optimization and fleet management platform
isPartOf.operatingSystem: Web, Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS

additionalProperty.name: Publicly Accessible API Documentation
additionalProperty.value: Benefits of using a telematics API: improve safety and productivity, while reducing life-cycle costs; optimise business operations and improve efficiency; track and monitor all your assets from one location; modern maintenance (with telematics API data provided) helps to reduce equipment failures; eliminate guesswork - accurate data enables you to make reliable decisions and calculate life-cycle costs.

additionalProperty.name: Wifi
additionalProperty.value: Telematics systems are increasingly incorporating Wi-Fi to enhance connectivity and functionality. This includes using Wi-Fi for establishing local area network connections, creating vehicle hotspots and enabling over-the-air software updates. Wi-Fi also plays a role in fleet management, allowing for data transfer and remote diagnostics.

additionalProperty.name: 3G
additionalProperty.value: Connected telematics services that rely on the 3G cellular network

additionalProperty.name: Satellite
additionalProperty.value: Although often used interchangeably, Satellite and GPS tracking refer to different concepts. GPS is a specific satellite-based navigation system operated by the US, consisting of 24 satellites. Satelite is a broader term that includes various satellite networks used for positioning, communication and data transmission, such as Globalstar, Iridium and Inmarsat

additionalProperty.name: OBD
additionalProperty.value: OBD (On-Board Diagnostics) in telematics is a standardized vehicle diagnostic system that allows telematics devices to plug into any vehicle's OBD-II port (standard since 1996) to extract real-time engine and vehicle data like speed, fuel consumption, and diagnostic codes. This data is then combined with GPS tracking and transmitted via cellular networks to provide fleet managers with comprehensive vehicle health monitoring, driver behavior analysis, and predictive maintenance capabilities.

additionalProperty.name: Driver's behavior monitoring
additionalProperty.value: A driver behavior monitoring system is a technology-driven solution that continuously tracks and analyzes how drivers operate their vehicles. By using vehicle telematics, GPS and various in-vehicle sensors, the system collects data on driving actions - speed, acceleration, braking and cornering - to provide real-time insights into driver performance.

additionalProperty.name: Security services
additionalProperty.value: Security services in telematics provide protection through multiple layers including theft prevention with real-time tracking and tamper alerts, unauthorized use detection via geofencing and after-hours monitoring, rapid stolen vehicle recovery, driver protection through dashcam evidence for false claim exoneration, cybersecurity measures with data encryption and authentication, system redundancy for critical safety functions, continuous monitoring and diagnostics.

additionalProperty.name: Real-time Dashcam capture
additionalProperty.value: Real-time dashcam capture is increasingly becoming a valuable feature within telematics systems, enhancing fleet management and safety. By integrating video with traditional telematics data like GPS location, speed and driving behavior, it provides a comprehensive view of vehicle and driver activity, enabling proactive safety measures and efficient incident response.

additionalProperty.name: Driver/vehicle scheduling
additionalProperty.value: Driver and vehicle scheduling features in transportation and logistics software optimize route assignments, manage driver availability and ensure efficient fleet utilization. These features streamline operations by automating tasks like route planning, vehicle assignment and shift scheduling, ultimately leading to cost savings and improved service delivery.

additionalProperty.name: GPS Tracking
additionalProperty.value: Telematics incorporates GPS tracking as a core component, enabling the monitoring of vehicle location and movement. Telematics systems use GPS data, along with other information from the vehicle's on-board diagnostics, to provide a comprehensive view of vehicle performance and driver behavior. This data is transmitted to a central system where it can be analyzed and used for fleet management, improving efficiency and enhancing safety.

additionalProperty.name: OBD GPS Tracking
additionalProperty.value: OBD GPS tracking uses a device plugged into a vehicle's On-Board Diagnostics (OBD) port to gather and transmit vehicle data, including location, speed and engine diagnostics, via GPS and cellular networks. This data is then used for telematics applications like fleet management, driver behavior analysis and maintenance scheduling

additionalProperty.name: Android (Management)
additionalProperty.value: Telematics management on Android involves using mobile applications to monitor, analyze and manage vehicle data collected by telematics devices. These tools allow for real-time tracking, driver behavior analysis, route optimization and more, enhancing fleet management and overall vehicle operations.

additionalProperty.name: iOS (Management)
additionalProperty.value: Managing telematics on iOS means using apps  to track, analyze and manage vehicle data from telematics devices. These tools give you real-time tracking, insights into driver behavior, route optimization and more - making fleet management and vehicle operations a whole lot smoother.

additionalProperty.name: RFID Driver ID
additionalProperty.value: RFID driver identification in telematics allows for tracking which driver is operating a vehicle by using radio-frequency identification (RFID) technology. This feature is especially useful when multiple drivers share the same vehicle, as it enables accurate tracking of vehicle usage and driver behavior.
